revised_title: John Smith Knox Boyd: A Life in Medicine and Military Service
tldr: This biographical memoir recounts the life of John Smith Knox Boyd, a Scottish medical doctor who served in World War I and made significant contributions to military medicine. Born in 1891, Boyd graduated from Glasgow University and worked as a ship's surgeon before joining the Royal Army Medical Corps. He served in various roles, including gas officer, medical officer to the Divisional Engineers, and in charge of a Mobile Laboratory. His experiences in the war exposed him to malaria, bacillary dysentery, and the challenges of treating soldiers in harsh conditions.
